Online Appendix A.1 Random route sampling method We sampled survey respondents using the random route method. Typically there is no village census from which to sample in rural Liberia. Thus interviewers were assigned a starting location (the center of the village, or the center of a town quarter in larger towns) and provided with a set of random walking rules: to spin a pen to select a direction, to use a paper-based random number generator to choose house number n, to select the nth house in that direction for a survey, and to select an adult in that household to interview at random. This does not produce a representative sample of the community, but it does sample community members similarly across the treatment arms. A.2 Descriptive statistics and balance test
